1.brief: I commend, prove, am composed of, cohere
1.long: I place together, commend, prove, exhibit; instrans: I stand with; I am composed of, cohere.

1.brief: but, on the other hand, and
1.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
Phoebe, a Christian woman in the church at Cenchreae.
a sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman.
a waiter, servant; then of any one who performs any service, an administrator.
an assembly, congregation, church; the Church, the whole body of Christian believers.
Cenchreae, the port of Corinth on the Saronic Gulf.

(a) I await, expect, (b) I receive, welcome (originally: to my house), (c) I accept.

2.long: worthily, in a manner worthy of.
set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred.

2.long: I bring, present, prove, come up to and stand by, am present.

2.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

2.brief: an untranslatable word that makes a statement contingent
2.long: an untranslatable word (under the circumstances, in that case, anyhow), the general effect of which is to make a statement contingent, which would otherwise be definite: it is thus regularly used with the subjunctive mood.
I need, have need of, want, desire.
a thing done, a deed, action; a matter, an affair.

Prisca, Priscilla, the former being the more correct and formal name, the latter a diminutive and more familiar; a Roman lady, probably of good birth, wife of the Jewish Christian Aquila.
the Greek way of writing the Latin Aquila, a male proper name; the husband of Priscilla (Prisca), and a Jew, of a family belonging to (Sinope in ?) Pontus.
Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.

4.long: gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
(a) the vital breath, breath of life, (b) the human soul, (c) the soul as the seat of affections and will, (d) the self, (e) a human person, an individual.
I put under, lay down, suggest to, put in mind.
I thank, give thanks; pass. 3 sing: is received with thanks.

an assembly, congregation, church; the Church, the whole body of Christian believers.

5.long: I greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome.

loved, beloved, with two special applications: the Beloved, a title of the Messiah (Christ), as beloved beyond all others by the God who sent Him; of Christians, as beloved by God, Christ, and one another.

the first-fruits, the earliest crop of the year, hence also met., for example, of the earliest converts in a district; there is evidence in favor of rendering in some passages merely by: sacrifice, gift.

5.brief: roughly the western third of Asia Minor
5.long: the Roman province of Asia, roughly the western third of Asia Minor.

into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

Timothy, a Christian of Lystra, helper of Paul.

Jason, a Christian of Thessalonica, perhaps the same as the "relative" of Paul.
akin to, related; subst: fellow countryman, kinsman.

a household manager, a steward, guardian.

time, a particular time, season.
age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.

27.long: an age, a cycle (of time), especially of the present age as contrasted with the future age, and of one of a series of ages stretching to infinity.
